titleStmt.title: Metal for metal: or, A proposal for a duty upon tin and pewter wrought in plates, dishes, or any other work whatsoever, of one penny upon every pound weight, to be levied as hereunder express'd, from the 1st of January 1695. for sixteen years next following; and the sum of money arising thereby to be applied to make good the loss upon the clipt money.

Metal for metal: or, A proposal for a duty upon tin and pewter wrought in plates, dishes, or any other work whatsoever, of one penny upon every pound weight, to be levied as hereunder express'd, from the 1st of January 1695. for sixteen years next following; and the sum of money arising thereby to be applied to make good the loss upon the clipt money.

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Reproduction of original in: Columbia University Library (New York, N.Y.).
